newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNISH '97 AVG MUNICIPAL INCOME TAX RATE 17.4 PCT.
newsitem.headline: FINNISH '97 AVG MUNICIPAL INCOME TAX RATE 17.4 PCT.

text.p: The average municipal income tax rate will be 17.43 percent in 1997, down 0.08 percentage points on 1996, the Assosiation of Finnishg Local Authorities said in a statement on Tuesday.

The average municipal income tax rate is weighted according to tax revenues. "The fall of the average (income tax rate) was mainly caused by the fact that the city of Helsinki lowered its tax rate by by 0.50 percentage points," the association said.
In total, 45 local authorities will lower their income tax rates next year compared to 1996, while 10 municipalities will raise theirs.
In the province of Aaland, 15 of the 16 local authorities will cut taxes for an average fall of 0.70 percentage points.
Karkkila, with a local income tax rate of 19.75 percent has the highest and Kauniainen, with 15.00 percent, the lowest.
